RouteRL.learning package

Submodules

RouteRL.learning.learning_model module

class RouteRL.learning.learning_model.BaseLearningModel[source]

Bases: ABC

This is an abstract base class for the learning models used to train the human and machine agents.

abstract act(state)[source]
abstract learn(state, action, reward)[source]
class RouteRL.learning.learning_model.Culo(params, initial_knowledge)[source]

Bases: BaseLearningModel

act(state) → int[source]

Selects an action based on the current state and cost.

Parameters: state: The current state of the environment.

Returns: int: The index of the selected action.

learn(state, action, reward)[source]

Updates the cost associated with the taken action based on the received reward.

Parameters: state: The current state of the environment. action (int): The action that was taken. reward (float): The reward received after taking the action.

class RouteRL.learning.learning_model.DQN(params, state_size, action_space_size)[source]

Bases: BaseLearningModel

act(state) → int[source]

Selects an action based on the current state using an epsilon-greedy strategy.

Parameters: state (array-like): The current state of the environment.

Returns: int: The index of the selected action.

decay_epsilon()[source]

Decays the epsilon value to reduce exploration over time.

learn(state, action, reward)[source]

Samples a batch from memory, computes the loss, and updates the Q-network.

class RouteRL.learning.learning_model.Network(state_size, action_space_size, num_hidden, widths)[source]

Bases: Module

forward(x)[source]

Forward pass through the network.

Parameters: x (Tensor): The input tensor representing the state.

Returns: Tensor: The output tensor representing Q-values for each action.

class RouteRL.learning.learning_model.QLearning(params, action_space_size)[source]

Bases: BaseLearningModel

act(state)[source]

Selects an action based on the current state using the epsilon-greedy strategy.

Parameters: state (list): The current state of the environment.

Returns: int: The index of the selected action.

decay_epsilon()[source]

Decays the epsilon value to reduce exploration over time.

ensure_row_in_q_table(state)[source]

Ensures the state is present in the Q-table. If not, a new row is added.

Parameters: state_str (str): The string representation of the current state.

learn(state, action, reward)[source]

Updates the Q-values for the given state-action pair based on the reward.

Parameters: state (list): The current state of the environment. action (int): The action that was taken. reward (float): The reward received after taking the action.
